item.title: 7-Eleven opens its first staff-free store in Melbourne CBD
item.description: <p>7-Eleven has opened its first vending machine only operation in the middle of Melbourne.</p>

item.title: Vandals believed to have caused Optus outage to more than 14,500 customers south of Melbourne
item.description: <p>The telco said an underground fibre cable was cut at a Telstra pit this morning, impacting regular and emergency calls and mobile data. </p>

item.title: Accused Melbourne CBD stabber fails in fresh bid for freedom
item.description: <p>An accused stabber who randomly attacked a woman walking to her job on a city street has failed in her bid for freedom.</p>

item.title: WA councillor who tried to expense a drink at Adelaide strip club resigns
item.description: <p>After criticism from Premier Roger Cook and others, Nige Jones officially tendered his resignation from the City of Joondalup Council.</p>

item.title: Treasurer leaves door open to $5 billion early Christmas gift for every household
item.description: <p>Treasurer Jim Chalmers has kept the door open for another round of electricity rebates, saying the government is yet to rule out what would be a second extension of its key cost-of-living relief policy.</p>

item.title: Melbourne former childcare worker charged over alleged assault of toddler
item.description: <p>A 41-year-old ﻿woman has been charged after allegedly slapping a three-year-old boy at a Melbourne early childhood education centre.</p>

item.title: No daily drug tests for pilots before Sea World crash, inquest hears
item.description: <p>The spotlight has been shone on a helicopter operator&#x27;s drug testing regime after a pilot killed in a horror mid-air crash tested positive to cocaine.</p>

item.title: New prosecutor won't pursue charges against Trump and others in Georgia election interference case
item.description: <p>The abandonment of the Georgia case is the latest reflection of how Trump has emerged largely unscathed from a spate of prosecutions that once threatened to imperil his political career and personal liberty.</p>

item.title: Today in History - November 27: Frank Sinatra arrested on an arcane charge
item.description: <p>Years before he became the biggest singer in the world, Frank Sinatra was arrested on an arcane charge on November 27, 1938.</p>

item.title: Thousands remain without power as NSW faces huge storm clean up

item.title: Aussies blocked from deepfake nudifying websites over child abuse material

item.title: Hong Kong residents set up crowdsourced app to track who's missing in deadly fire

item.title: Barnaby Joyce confirms defection from Nationals, but says no decision made on One Nation move

item.title: Australian National Weather Forecast
